subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Among its close
Trachelas
relatives in China , this species is very similar to
Trachelas sinensis
Chen, Peng et Zhao, 1995
, can be distinguished from the latter only by: ( 1 ) bursa globose, while club-shaped in the latter; ( 2 ) the shape of the tibial apophysis; ( 3 ) the pattern of the abdomen.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 7. Leg measurements of
Trachelas japonicus Bösenberg et Strand, 1906
, male.

subSubSection.paragraph: Abdomen yellow brown, with two pairs of sigilla medially and several pairs of white irregular markings on both sides on its dorsal surface. Venter of abdomen light brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 23–30.
Trachelas japonicus Bösenberg et Strand, 1906
. 23. Male body, dorsal view (from Mt. Damao). 24. Left chelicera of male, posterior view (from Mt. Damao). 25. Endites, labium and sternum of male, ventral view (from Mt. Damao). 26. Male left metatarsus and tarsus IV, lateral view (from Mt. Damao). 27. Male left leg III, lateral view (from Mt. Damao). 28. Male right metatursus II, ventral view, showing cusps (from Mt. Baishi). 29. Male right metatarsus and tarsus I, lateral view, showing cusps (from Mt. Baishi). 30. Carapace and Chelicerae of male, front view (from Mt. Baishi). Ch = chilum; Cu = cusps; Gr = granulation; It = intercoxal triangles. Scale bars: 1 mm (23, 27–30); 0.3 mm (24–26).

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Carapace colour, eye arrangement, abdominal colouration as for male. Total body length 3.67– 4.50 . A female specimen was measured (Mt. Damao), total length 3.89 ; cephalothorax 1.62 long, 1.30 wide; abdomen 2.07 long, 1.44 wide. Clypeus 0.10 . Eye diameters: AME 0.07 , ALE 0.10 , PME 0.08 , PLE 0.08 ; eye interdistances: AME–AME 0.05 , AME–ALE 0.05 , PME–PME 0.08 , PME–PLE 0.08 ; MOA 0.18 long, anterior width 0.15 , posterior width 0.27 . Legs without spines and cusps. Leg formula: 1423 (Table 8 ).

Distribution. China (Hebei, Shanxi, Liaoning, Zhejiang, Hunan); Japan ; Korea .
